abstract: Christian Wulff, who stepped down as Germany’s president in February after prosecutors asked Parliament to strip him of his immunity from prosecution over accusations of improper ties to business executives, will receive a pension of $266,000 a year for the rest of his life.
lead_paragraph: Christian Wulff, who served 20 months in office and stepped down last month amidst a scandal, will receive a pension of $266,000 a year for the rest of his life, the president’s office said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Germany: A Hefty Pension for Life for a President Who Left in Disgrace
